title: ImportError: Cannot load backend 'WXAgg' which requires the 'wx' interactive framework, as 'headless' is currently running
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

After a fresh install of docker for my ubuntu 18.04 system, I successfully pulled the deeplabcut-latest-gui-jupyter image from Dockerhub.  However, when I call 'deeplabcut-docker gui' on my terminal I get the following output:
> "ImportError: Cannot load backend 'WXAgg' which requires the 'wx' interactive framework, as 'headless' is currently running
[2022-04-27T12:14:09-0700]: Failed to launch the DLC GUI. Used args: "-e DISPLAY=unix -v /tmp/.X11-unix:/tmp/.X11-unix -v :/home/developer/.Xauthority -v /home/carmen:/app -w /app "
Container stopped.

I'm wondering if this has anything to do with the fact that I don't have an NVIDIA GPU, and I haven't been able to install an NVIDIA driver for that reason.  I'm also new to WSL and Ubuntu, so possibly I am just misunderstanding some basic installation concept.  Any help would be greatly appreciated!

### Operating System

Ubuntu 18.04

### DeepLabCut version

N/A

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) on Windows 11 Home 64-bit
Intel(R) UHD Graphics

### Steps To Reproduce

In Ubuntu 18.04:

> from https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/ubuntu/:
``` 
 sudo apt-get update
 sudo apt-get install \
    ca-certificates \
    curl \
    gnupg \
    lsb-release
curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg
echo \
  "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu \
  $(lsb_release -cs) stable" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list > /dev/null
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io docker-compose-plugin

```
After running `sudo docker run hello-world` I get the correct message printed.

> from 	https://hub.docker.com/r/deeplabcut/deeplabcut/tags:

```
docker pull deeplabcut/deeplabcut:latest-gui-jupyter'
```

> Install DLC helper, finish other setup steps

```pip install deeplabcut-docker
sudo groupadd docker
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER
sudo reboot
deeplabcut-docker gui
```
